abstract: It’s Dec. 31, and we serve up a Times crossword tradition.
snippet: It’s Dec. 31, and we serve up a Times crossword tradition.
lead_paragraph: SUNDAY’S PUZZLE — We’ve talked recently about how puzzles evolve by breaking traditions, but there is something very satisfying about establishing and reinforcing new ones as well. One modern tradition that many of us look forward to is a special end-of-year Sunday puzzle from Elizabeth C. Gorski. It doesn’t happen every year but I’ve done the math and there’s a strong statistical correlation between years that end with a Gorski Sunday and stock market performance over the subsequent 12 months. It’s time to buy.
